## ğŸ“‹ Checklist

### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the project's coding standards
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have removed any debugging code or unnecessary comments

### Documentation
- [ ] I have updated relevant documentation
- [ ] I have added/updated code comments where needed
- [ ] I have updated the README if needed
- [ ] I have added examples for new features

### Safety & Security
- [ ] My changes don't introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I haven't included any secrets, passwords, or personal information
- [ ] Hardware changes follow proper electrical safety practices
- [ ] Changes maintain user privacy and data protection

### Community
- [ ] I have read and followed the contributing guidelines
- [ ] My commit messages are clear and descriptive
- [ ] I am willing to address feedback and make revisions
- [ ] I understand this code will be open source under MIT license
